meanings.sent1: She could foreknow the outcome of the experiment.
meanings.sent2: I always foreknow what my mom will say when I ask to go out.
meanings.sent3: The psychic claimed to foreknow the lottery numbers.
meanings.sent4: His intuition seemed to foreknow the dangers ahead.
meanings.sent5: The ancient oracle was said to foreknow the future with accuracy.

meanings.sent1: The wise old man seemed to foreknow the village's troubles.
meanings.sent2: Some people believe they can foreknow events through dreams.
meanings.sent3: The fortune teller claimed to foreknow the fate of the lost travelers.
meanings.sent4: Her eerie ability to foreknow disasters was both a gift and a burden.
meanings.sent5: The weathered sailor appeared to foreknow the storm approaching the coast.

meanings.sent1: I could foreknow his reaction to the news.
meanings.sent2: The experienced detective could foreknow the suspect's next move.
meanings.sent3: The children tried to foreknow what presents they would get for their birthdays.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition allowed her to foreknow the market trends.
meanings.sent5: The ancient seer was believed to foreknow the rise and fall of kingdoms.
